text: Szczecin-Dąbie Airstrip is a small airstrip on right side of the river in Szczecin (Poland) in Dąbie. It was built on grass in 1921. During the Third Reich, there were a lot of domestic flights from this airport. After World War II to 23 May 1967, when the airport was moved to Goleniów, it was the main airport of Szczecin, where LOT Polish Airlines has their flights. Now it is a sport airstrip for small airplanes. Category:Airports in Poland Category:Szczecin Category:1921 establishments in Europe Category:1920s establishments in Poland
title: Szczecin-Dąbie Airstrip
